dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Since I met you, baby, My whole life has changed... Ecstatic, COLE sticks his head out the window again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE'S POV:  the heavens, glittering with a million stars lover's moon as IVORY JOE croons the achingly romantic ly IVORY JOE/RADIO (cont. o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- cause since I met you, baby. All I need is you..." ANGLE ON COLE, wind in his hair, eyes shining, gulping ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE OFFICERS and an anxious MARILOU MARTIN listen answering machine's message while a hungry CAT cries plai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Railly -- this is Palmer from Psych Admitting.  There was a guy here this afternoon looking for you.  He seemed very agitated.  We tried to keep him, but he refused 'n I kept thinking, I know this guy.  Then, just a few minutes ago, it came to me.  It's Cole!  James Cole. Remember him?  The paranoid who pulled the Houdini back in '89.  Well, he's back and he's...cuckoo...and he's looking for you.  I thought you oughta know. The machine switches off.  The POLICE OFFICERS exchange a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just as I told you -- my husband and I had gone ahead -- she never showed.  That's totally unlike her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out his notebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you happen to know the make of her car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...Acura...'92 Acura. ... Also, that cat's starving!  She would never neglect her cat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ACURA is parked outside room 46 of the HIGHWAYS & MOTEL, which has definitely seen better days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is on.  A commercial is just starting.  A catfood The sound of HEAVY BREATHING. ANGLE ON COLE, sweating, BREATHING HEAVILY, sprawled on o of the double bed, sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNSHOT!  YOUNG COLE glimpses the BLONDE MAN staggering, The mysterious BRUNETTE races past him toward the BLONDE YOUNG COLE again glimpses the resemblance to RAILLY, in s the dark hair, the make-up, the flashy earrings. Close at hand, YOUNG COLE'S FATHER, his face still out of FATHER'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, it's important for your cat to have the nourishment necessary for healthy bones and a rich coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE comes awake with a start.  He stares, disoriented, a CATFOOD COMMERCIAL on the TV. RAILLY'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please untie me.  I'm very uncomfortable. COLE turns to RAILLY, beside him on the bed, frightened a helpless, her jacket arranged to restrain her like a stra COLE'S instinct is to free her at once, but he controls h impulse.  He looks away, gets up, and, wincing, limps to dresser, stepping around empty fast-food cartons.  He pul razor and shaving soap from a paper bag, then goes into t bathroom, leaving the door open, and starts to shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in my dream just now.  Your hair was different, but I'm sure it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We dream about what's important in our lives. And I seem to have become pretty important in yours.  What was the dream about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an airport...before everything happened.  It's the same dream I always have -- the only one.  I'm a little kid in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was in it?  What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very upset.  You're always very upset in the dream, but I never knew it was you before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me before, James.  It's become me now because of...what's happening.  Please untie me. Finished shaving, COLE re-enters the bedroom, toweling hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think it was always you.  It's very strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're flushed.  And you were moaning. I think you're running a fever.  What are you doing? COLE is rummaging through RAILLY'S wallet, pulling out mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a minute. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Don't leave me here like this! Too late!  He shuts the door behind him, leaving her alon ANGLE ON THE TV SCREEN, where an ANCHORMAN sits at a News

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in Fresno, California...crews continue to attempt to rescue nine year old Ricky Neuman. ANGLE ON RAILLY, twisting and struggling on the bed, tryi get loose, tears welling in her eyes. TV ANCHORMAN (cont. o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy was playing ball with four other children when he literally disappeared off the face of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE puzzles over a junk food vending machine, inserts co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON TV, the picture of RAILLY filling the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My notes.  Observations.  Clues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clues?  What kind of clues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret army.  The Army of The Twelve Monkeys.  I've told you about them. They spread the virus.  That's why we have to get to Philadelphia.  I have to find them -- it's my assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do...when you find this...secret army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have to locate the virus in its original form before it mutates.  So scientists can come back and study it and find a cure.  So that those of us who survived can go back to the surface of the earth. RAILLY maintains a professional deadpan, says nothing as a pickup truck with a MOTHER, FATHER, and five KIDS in th COLE stares at the KIDS, a sad look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't think I'm crazy next month. People are going to start dying.  At first the papers will say it's some weird fever, some virus.  Then they'll begin to catch on.  They'll get it. RADIO NEWSCASTER (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We interrupt this program with a special bulletin... RAILLY and COLE both react to the radio, suddenly alert. RADIO NEWSCASTER (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This report just in from Fresno, California.  Naval sonar specialists who were flown to the site...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was about us.  I thought maybe they'd found us and arrested me or something. RAILLY stares at COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a joke. RADIO NEWSCASTER (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- an hour ago have been unable to determine the location of the boy in the 150 foot shaft...but a TV sound man who lowered an ultra-sensitive microphone into the narrow tube claims he heard breathing sounds coming from approximately seventy feet down... COLE reaches over and changes stations.  MUSIC again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that disturb you, James?  Thinking about that little boy in the well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid I identified with that kid, down there alone in that pipe...a hundred feet down -- doesn't know if they're going to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean -- when you were a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind.  It's not real -- it's a hoax.  A prank.  He's hiding in a barn. Hey, turn left here.  Left! COLE quickly checks the map as RAILLY stares, then turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly EVANGELIST with long stringy hair, wearing a t bathrobe, stands on a Skid Row corner WAVING a worn Bible rants at disinterested DERELICTS, WINOS, and BAG LADIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses and dragons in their pleasant palaces:  and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged." ANGLE ON RAILLY'S ACURA, crawling down the street, RAILLY COLE, beside her, staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE is scrutinizing the crumbling walls, boarded-up stor fronts, tattered posters, decaying signs, miserable "RESI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I come from we think of this as Eden. If we could just see the sun, eat sun-grown food.  Eden!  Look at them!  They donut know what they have.  They don't see the sky.  They don't feel the air! COLE'S POV:  a BMW speeds toward them, passes, its radio COLE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the ones who aren't hungry are so smug they haven't a clue.  WAIT!  STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On foot now, COLE pulls an astonished RAILLY to a wall co graffiti, a hopeless tangle of symbols, words, and crude Clueless, RAILLY stares at the wall, then at COLE. COLE touches a bit of red-stenciled graffiti hidden under insignias.  We can just see TWELVE MONKEYS holding hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Twelve Monkeys!!!  They're here. (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere.  Come on! He pulls her along the sidewalk.  No question, he's insan At the next alley entrance, COLE stops abruptly.  Then, s keeping a firm grip on RAILLY'S arm, he starts ripping do tacked-up posters announcing a Rap concert. RAILLY stares at him, then turns and is looking all aroun suddenly, COLE pulls her up tight and threatens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm warning you.  You do anything, I'm going to go crazy -- hurt people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to "do" anything, I promise.  But you need help, James. None of this is what you think it is. ANGLE ON COLE, not listening, staring triumphantly!  He's another partially obscured stencil of THE TWELVE MONKEYS! But just then, a raspy VOICE startles COLE. RASPY VOICE (o.s)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't hide from them, Bob. COLE whirls, sees a derelict, LOUIE, leering at him, spea voice eerily like the RASPY VOICE from the next cell in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, Old Bob -- don't even try. (conspiratorially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear everything.  They got that tracking device on you.  They can find you anywhere.  Anytime.  Ha Ha! RAILLY looks from LOUIS to COLE, sees COLE'S stunned reac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his back jaw)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the tooth, Bob!  Right? (sudden triumphant grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I fooled 'em, old buddy! He opens his mouth wide.  NO TEETH' COLE grabs RAILLY and pulls her into the alley and down i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're keeping an eye on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's keeping an eye on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man...with the voice.  I recognized him.  He's from the present.  He... COLE breaks off, freezes as he sees... there on a brick wall is a stencil of the DANCING MONKEYS And further on, another red stencil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACKHEADS huddle against a building, sucking their pipes oblivious to COLE pulling RAILLY past. COLE scans the walls for messages in the confusion of gra RAILLY is considering her surroundings dubiously when, su COLE pulls her toward the mouth of a dark and forbidding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, no -- we shouldn't be here! COLE ignores her, yanking her after him into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two TOM CATS face off, arching their backs and HISSING me COLE avoids them as he pulls RAILLY into the gloom. ANGLE ON RAILLY, seeing something alarming twenty yards a RAILLY'S POV:  TWO THUGS, standing over a MAN, kicking hi RAILLY tries to stop, but COLE, intent on the wall messag doesn't notice the THUGS. The TWO THUGS turn and spot COLE and RAILLY moving toward These creeps have mean eyes, predator faces. RAILLY digs her heels in, forcing COLE to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!  We have to go back.  Those men... Too late.  While COLE turns and stares at her, uncomprehe the TWO THUGS are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. Startled, COLE turns to face them. The SECOND THUG lunges for RAILLY'S purse, yanks it from COLE reaches to grab it back, but...WHACK!  The FIRST THU COLE hard across the face with something metallic. Bloody-faced, dazed, COLE doesn't even have a chance to c head as the FIRST THUG shoves the hard object against COL cheek.  It's a cheap thirty-eight pistol. RAILLY turns to run, gets two steps before the SECOND THU her roughly to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick around, bitch. Looming over her, the SECOND THUG starts to unzip his fly RAILLY looks over to COLE, SEES... COLE dropping to his knees, groveling at the FIRST THUG'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!  Please don't hurt me! The FIRST THUG steps close, kicks COLE contemptuously, co foot for a second kick when... COLE uncoils, lunging, rising, his strong arms around the man's calves, lifting him mightily, high off the ground. The gun FIRES wildly as COLE staggers forward with the FI in his arms and smashes the man into the brick wail behin The FIRST THUG goes down in a heap, dropping the pistol. Zipping his fly hastily, the SECOND THUG turns to deal wi but COLE attacks him....rocking him again and again with blows that come one after another with lightning speed. THUG staggers back, bloody and dazed as RAILLY watches, a Turning back to the FIRST THUG, COLE sees the MAN reachin the dropped pistol. COLE kicks him viciously in the jaw.  The FIRST THUG'S he back.  SNAP!  He collapses against the brick wall. COLE turns back to see the SECOND THUG retreating down th as fast as he can stagger. RAILLY stares up at COLE.  He looks very dangerous.  He g in her direction as he pockets the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.  Yes.  I mean, just some scrapes... As RAILLY gets to her feet, she sees COLE bend over the motionless THUG and quickly go through his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he...alive? COLE ignores the question as he pockets the man's wallet handful of bullets, then turns and snaps at RAILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come an.  We're running out of time. You can't help him. As COLE yanks her roughly away, she looks back, sees the THUG'S sightless eyes, wide open...staring blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, James!  You killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did him a favor.  Now come on. COLE, pulling her again, sees more "12 MONKEYS" on the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have a gun before, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EVANGELIST, spotting COLE and RAILLY hurrying past hi points urgently at COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  You!  You're one of us, aren't you? But COLE has stopped and is staring at... A STOREFRONT OFFICE...its windows covered with posters. over the office says, FREEDOM FOR ANIMALS ASSOCIATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earnest young activists, FALE, deathly pale, BEN, long ha and TEDDY, muscular, are gathered around a counter collat leaflets that demand an END TO SPECIEISM.  Behind them, a poster proclaims, "ANIMALS HAVE SOULS, TOO".  Just then, a tremendous CLAP OF THUNDER as the ACTIVISTS look up and COLE and RAILLY enter. COLE looks startled.  It sounds like torrential RAIN POUR here.  Maintaining a tight grip on RAILLY'S wrist, he loo around frantically for an explanation for the tropical do Bookshelves line two walls.  The front window is blanked posters of Animal Rights demonstrations, newspaper clippi photos of animal atrocities.  The fourth wall features th counter where the three ACTIVISTS face COLE as a JUNGLE B SCREAMS in the DOWNPOUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, can we help you? COLE looks confused as the RAIN abates and an ELEPHANT tr an urgent warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  You looking for something in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, James -- it's just a tape. COLE'S eyes follow her look.  It's a tape recorder undern sign advertising, "THE TRUE MUSIC OF THE WORLD".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I'm looking for the, ah, the Army of the Twelve Monkeys. FALE glances at BEN and TEDDY.  "We have a problem!" the MONKEYS start CHATTERING on the tape as TEDDY comes aroun counter, bigger than COLE, physically imposing, menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know anything about any "Army of the Twelve Monkeys", so why don't you and your friend disappear, okay? COLE backs away, a firm grip on RAILLY, as a LION ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need some information...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear me?  We're not... TEDDY breaks off mid-sentence...freezes. COLE is pointing a pistol at them.  A TIGER SNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, no -- don't hurt them. (to the activists)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'm a psychiatrist -- just do whatever he tells you to do.  He's... upset -- disturbed.  Please -- he's dangerous -- just cooperate. MONKEYS CHATTER wildly as TEDDY backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want -- money?  We only have a few bucks. COLE is suddenly very much in charge and self-confident a BABOON HOWLS with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you what I want. (snaps at Railly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, why don't we...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock it now! RAILLY hurries to the door to lock it as BEN says to FALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that fuckhead Mason would get us into something like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey Mason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tucking, crazy Jeffrey Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three ACTIVISTS are tied tightly together in the midd the floor in this dimly-lit, windowless basement.  They'r frightened, eager to cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Jeffrey becomes like this...big star -- the media latch on to him because he's picketing his own father, a "famous Nobel Prize winning virologist". You musta seen all that on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't watch TV. COLE, the gun next to him, rummages through boxes of pape RAILLY watches helplessly.  Suddenly, COLE finds somethin thinks he's seen before.  He holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this him -- Dr. Mason? It's a photograph of DR. MALCOLM MASON, being escorted by phalanx of riot cops through a mob of raging activists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at the photo, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more about Jeffrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a helpless shrug to his cohorts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey started getting bored with the shit we do...picketing, leafleting, letter-writing stuff.  He said we were, "ineffectual liberal jerkoffs".  He wanted to do guerrilla "actions" to "educate" the public. COLE holds up a clipping showing horrified SENATORS stand their desks as RATTLESNAKES slither along the Senate Floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's when he let a hundred snakes loose in the Senate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we weren't into that kind of stuff. It's counter productive, we told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he and eleven others split off and became this underground..."army"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army of The Twelve Monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They started planning a "Human Hunt".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bought stun guns and nets and bear traps.  They were gonna go to Wall Street and trap lawyers and bankers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they didn't do it.  They didn't do any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just like always, Mr. Big Shot sold his friends out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes on TV, gives a news conference, tells the whole world he just realized his daddy's experiments are vital for humanity and that the use of animals is absolutely necessary and that he, Jeffrey Mason, from now on, is going to personally supervise the labs to make sure all the little animals aren't going to suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a rolodex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the crawling traffic, WE FIND a battered FORD covered bumper stickers and painted slogans.  "I BRAKE FOR ANIMAL

dialogues.speaker: "FREE THE ANIMALS"..."WOULD YOU LET A MINK WEAR YOUR SKIN
dialogues.text: RAILLY (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just barge in on a famous scientist.  They'll have security guards, gates, alarm systems.  It's insane, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROLODEX CARD with an address on "Outerbridge Road" for Mason c/o Dr. Malcolm Mason" rests on a map spread across lap.  COLE is in the passenger seat, RAILLY'S at the whee maneuvering in heavy traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those young men don't get loose, they could die in that basement. COLE glances out the window, indicates the PEOPLE in pass cars...COMMUTERS, FAMILIES, TRUCKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I see are dead people.  Everywhere. What's three more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, carefully, a new tack)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Dr. Mason's son, Jeffrey Mason, don't you, James?  You met him in the County Hospital six years ago. COLE is studying the map again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy was a total fruitcake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he told you then his father was a famous virologist. COLE is absorbed in the map, his finger tracing "Outerbri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- he said his father was "God"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO BLARES a country song as the Ford zips along an highway.  COLE has his head out the window, sucking air, the music, but his bliss is feverish now -- he's not well the SONG ends, he pulls his head inside.  An ANNOUNCER'S intones over the RADIO... RADIO ANNOUNCER (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just in:  police are widening their search for Dr. Kathryn Railly, prominent psychiatrist and author. Authorities confirm that Dr. Railly has been abducted by escaped mental patient, James Cole. The two are believed to be traveling in Railly's 1992 black Acura, license plate H-E-A-D-D-R. RAILLY glances at him, sees he's in pain.  She feels so b him.  She wants to help him.  She says, tenderly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't go on, James.  You're not well.  You're burning with fever. COLE, refusing to succumb, instead, leans over to check t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't know how to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was too young to drive.  I didn't say I was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with your leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got shot.  Look -- there's a gas station up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot!  Who shot you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was some kind of...war.  Never mind, you wouldn't believe me.  Turn off here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GAS STATION ATTENDANT checks the oil while COLE and R remain in the car.  She's pulling a gas card from her wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to run out off gas on purpose, weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I want you to turn yourself in, James -- It'll go much better for you if you do -- but I'm not going to trick you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees the credit card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has your name on it.  Give him cash. RAILLY puts the card back into her wallet and pulls out c the GAS STATION ATTENDANT slams the hood down. RAILLY starts opening the door.  Alarmed, COLE tries to s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? She looks him in the eye, then indicates the tiny Conveni Store appended to the Gas Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come with me.  I have to get some things.  Scissors, bandages, some alcohol or whiskey. ... I have to look at your leg, James.  I'm a doctor. COLE looks helpless, hesitant.  She's in charge...for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun dazzles through the canopy of leaves.  We HEAR th RADIO but not the engine. RADIO ANNOUNCER (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile in Fresno, where mining engineers continue their desperate attempt to sink a shaft parallel to the ant in which nine year old... COLE, in his underwear, leans back on a large rock beside Ford, his pants hanging on the car's open door.  He's sta at the sun and the sky.  RAILLY finishes bandaging his th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't put your weight on it. You need stitches and antibiotics. Lucky for you it was near the surface. RAILLY wraps the bullet in some gauze and sticks it in he while COLE continues staring up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love seeing the sun. A beat.  COLE tries to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- let me help you. RAILLY puts an arm around him and helps him to his feet. They're very close.  They don't move.  RAILLY looks like barely breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans closer, shuts his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to concentrate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to give yourself up, you know. A beat.  The spell is broken.  He reaches for his pants, turns back to her, suddenly grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do something now.  Something I don't want to do.  I'm so sorry. RAILLY reacts, sudden fear in her eyes.  He looms over he cold now, steeled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a mission.  It's important. RAILLY steps back...horrified, realizing she's going to d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRET SERVICE AGENT ambles vigilantly among the rows o cars parked beside the brightly-lit rural mansion.  Encou another AGENT, he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid.  The one in the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe this?  They're dropping a monkey down there with a miniature infra-red camera strapped on him and a roast beef sandwich wrapped in tinfoil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making that up! ANGLE UNDER A PARKED MERCEDES, where COLE is hiding, list the receding VOICES of the AGENTS. SECOND AGENT (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shit you not. ... Man, life is weird! A monkey and a sandwich.  Wonder who thought that one up. FIRST AGENT (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probly give the sonafabitch a Nobel Prize! Quickly, COLE rolls to the next car and under it.  He doe see...the pistol fell out of his pocket, under the Merced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formal dinner for forty.  Desert has been served.  DR. MASON rises to the enthusiastic applause of the GUESTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that I could enjoy this opulent dinner and this excellent and stimulating company for itself, with no sense of purpose.  But alas, I am "burdened" with the sense that with all this excess of public attention and this cacophony of praise, there comes great responsibility.  Indeed, I practically feel a soapbox growing under my feet whenever I stand for more than a few seconds. While GUESTS laugh at DR. MASON'S last remark, SECRET SER AGENT #3 enters the room, scowling, looking for someone. DR. MASON (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dangers of science are a time worn threat, from Prometheus stealing fire from the Gods to the Cold War era of the Dr. Strangelove Terror. AGENT #3 spots who he's looking for.  JEFFREY MASON! DR. MASON (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But never before, not even at Los Alamos when the scientists made bets on whether their first atomic bomb test would wipe out New Mexico, has science given us so much reason to fear the power we have at hand. ANGLE ON JEFFREY, as AGENT #3 whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  What friend?  I'm not expecting anyone. ANGLE ON DR. MASON, reacting with irritation to the distu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Current genetic engineering as well as my own work with viruses has presented us with powers as terrifying as any... ANGLE ON JEFFREY, following the AGENT out of the dining r grumbling loudly enough to disturb his father's audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.  My father is making a major address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation continues as JEFFREY and AGENT #3 enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally if we caught a guy sneaking around like this with no I.D., we'd bust his ass, excuse the French, but this one said he knows you... (smirk, smirk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and, since you seem to have had some...uh...unusual...uh..."associates", we certainly didn't want to arrest one of your, uh, closest...pals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE, smudged with dirt and car grease, sitting in the sh a wingback chair, looks up as JEFFREY and AGENT #3 enter room.  A FOURTH AGENT looms beside the wingback chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing Cole casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never saw him before in my life.  Go ahead and shoot him or torture him or whatever it is you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know me.  You helped me once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be totally out of character. Helping people is against my principles. (to the Agents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, he definitely doesn't know me.  Now, I'm going to go back and listen to my father's very eloquent discourse on the perils of science WHILE YOU TORTURE THIS INTRUDER TO DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here about some monkeys. Halfway out the door, JEFFREY freezes.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkeys.  Twelve of them. JEFFREY frowns, turns, considers COLE.  Then, suddenly, J rushes to COLE and embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold...Arnold. COLE is astonished.  The AGENTS are, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Arnie, what's happened to you? You look like shit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I know him.  What do you think -- I act like this to strangers? Listen -- you fellas are terrific.  I thought you were pulling a number on me.  What a terrible thing if you'd thrown old Arnie out.  I owe you guys the big apologia!  Mea culpa, fellas. (turning to Cole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Arnie, it's black tie!  I mean, I said, "drop by," but, like, this is Dad's big "do"...vips, senators, secret service, and...and everything. JEFFREY throws an arm around COLE'S shoulder and starts l him toward the door as the two AGENTS exchange narrow-eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Arnie?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold Pettibone.  Old Arnie Pettibone. Used to be my best friend.  Still is. What've you lost, Arnie -- forty pounds? No wonder I didn't know you. You hungry? Lots of dead cow, dead lamb, dead pig. Real killer feast we're putting on tonight. The AGENTS watch JEFFREY lead the limping, disheveled COL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people -- all of 'em -- are true weirdoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna call in a description of this "Pettibone" character.  You go keep an eye on him.  Make sure he doesn't do one of the guests with a fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUESTS pouring from the dining room into the hall meet JE and a very disconcerted COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, nice ta see ya.  Lookin' good!  Hi, there.  Yes, it has been a long time. In the b.g., too far away to hear them, AGENT #4 trails J COLE as they maneuver through the GUESTS toward the grand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Cole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: County Hospital, right?  1989.  The "Immaculate Escape" -- am I right? (smiling to guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you -- you look wonderful, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- I can't do anything about what you're going to do. I can't change anything.  I can't stop you.  I just want some information...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.  Come on.  Upstairs. (to a guest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a new person!  I'm completely adjusted.  Witness the tux.  It's Armani. (whispers to Cole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who chattered?  Goines?  Weller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to have access to the pure virus, that's all!  For the future! JEFFREY studies COLE.  COLE doesn't just talk crazy.  He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, follow me.  You don't lock so good. JEFFREY starts guiding COLE up the grand staircase as COL back, spots AGENT #3 and AGENT #4, both keeping an eye on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time to go upstairs.  The police are looking for me.  I need to know where it is and exactly what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it!  This is your old plan, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan?  What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember?  We were in the dayroom, watching TV, and you were all upset about the...desecration of the planet. And you said to me, "Wouldn't it be great if there was a germ or a virus that could wipe out mankind and leave the plants and animals just as they are?"  You do remember that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bulishit!  You're fucking with my head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when I told you my father was this famous virologist and you said, "Hey, he could make a germ and we could steal it!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jeffrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you dumb fuck!  The thing mutates We live underground!  The world belongs to the fucking dogs and cats.  We're like moles or worms.  All we want to do is study the original...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- take it easy.  We know who you are, Mr. Cole. COLE feels a firm grip on his shoulder, turns and sees AG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go somewhere and talk this thing over. Okay? Just come with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right!  Absolutely right.  Me's a nut case, totally deranged.  Delusional! Paranoid.  HIS PROCESSOR'S ALL FUCKED UP, HIS INFORMATION TRAY IS JAMMED. AGENT #4 is wishing JEFFREY would chill out even as the T AGENT is climbing up the staircase to help. COLE is like a trapped animal. He's being led down the st now with JEFFREY, right on his heels, yelling so EVERYONE

dialogues.speaker: GRAND PLOT
dialogues.text: COLE stares back at JEFFREY as both AGENTS hustle COLE do stairs.  It sounds true!  JEFFREY'S so confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Mr. Mason, we've got him. Everything's...

dialogues.speaker: KNOW WHERE HE THINKS HE COMES FROM
dialogues.text: Suddenly, COLE, catching the AGENTS by surprise, wrenches shoves them aside, and stumbles down the rest of the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE heads for the front door, but there's an AGENT there turns and limps madly toward the dining room, pushing his through the crowd of amazed GUESTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERVANTS, clearing the table, look up astonished as two A burst into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did a man just come through here...limping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COOKS stare, amazed, as two OTHER AGENTS burst into the k and look about urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large projection TV is on and a knot of GUESTS is gathe front of it...watching the spooky VIDEO IMAGES. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These pictures we are seeing are coming to us live from deep inside the pipe. You can just make out the metal wall behind those roots and I guess those must be spider webs. MRS. McCANN, a guest, watching the TV, expresses concern. MRS. McCANN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you ask me, I think that monkey is going to eat the sandwich himself. Just then, two AGENTS burst into the den. The GUESTS turn from the TV, startled, stare open-mouthed the AGENTS have spotted an open window and are hurrying t AGENTS POV OUT THE WINDOW:  the rows of expensive parked ON THE TV SCREEN, RAILLY'S photograph appears. TV ANCHOR (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just in:  Police say that the body of a woman found strangled in the Knutson state Park could be kidnap victim, Dr. Kathryn Railly. As the AGENTS run out of the room, a photo of RAILLY'S ab Acura comes up on the TV screen. TV ANCHOR (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier in the day, police located Railly's abandoned car not far from a building where three animal rights activists were found bound and gagged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pistols drawn, AGENTS move cautiously among the rows of p luxury cars, checking inside and under the vehicles. AN AGENT'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE, scrunched down on the floor next to the driver's se spots the key dangling from the ignition, then lifts his slightly to study the shift mechanism, trying to figure i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENTS continue to move cautiously among the parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE eases himself into the driver's seat, tentatively sl shift into "Drive", then turns the key.  Nothing happens. Panic.  COLE studies the shift again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT #5 approaches the row where the Jaguar is parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE slides the shift from D (Drive) to N (Neutral).  He the key again.  The engine ROARS...SEVEN THOUSAND RPM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT #5 whirls at the sound. SMASH.  The JAGUAR clips the Mercedes parked in front of accelerates right at him! AGENT #5 dives aside just as the speeding JAGUAR whizzes him, slams into a parked Cadillac, bounces off, grinds be two other parked vehicles with a fierce scream of tearing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught between two cars, COLE can only lean on the gas pe The JAGUAR comes free with a great SCCCREEEEECH... COLE sees the driveway ahead in the moonlight.  Steering he plows through shrubs and gardens heading for the drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights off, veering wildly, the JAGUAR reaches the drivew AGENTS are leaping into cars and a HELICOPTER is coming t its rotors whipping around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE turns onto the road, careening crazily from one side other, unable to see ahead with no headlights.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS
dialogues.text: He starts hitting switches.  The wipers come on, the RADI RADIO REPORTER'S VOICE/RADIO (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---when they pulled the monkey out, it was still clutching the tinfoil wrapped sandwich. Rounding a bend, an ONCOMING CAR heads straight at COLE. COLE yanks the wheel as the OTHER CAR, horn BLARING, just Recovering, COLE loses the road, speeds crazily along the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT, an agent, steers the chopper while the CO-PILO spotlight over the two lane road beneath them. Just then, the PILOT sees headlights below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  He's showing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE can see the road now in his headlights as the windsh wipers scrape frantically and the RADIO BLARES... RADIO REPORTER'S VOICE/RADIO (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know what to think.  They didn't locate him and they don't know how much longer he can last, that's assuming the boy is still alive. A spotlight hits the car and COLE hears the sound of the HELICOPTER as it lowers over him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HELICOPTER maneuvers over the speeding JAGUAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE can see the underbelly of the HELICOPTER a few feet his front windshield. Desperate, he yanks the wheel hard, veering off the road. COLE'S POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD:  dense woods ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper pulls up sharply, avoiding the trees, then le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT skims the top of the trees while the CO-PILOT r forest below with his spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!  Where is he? The CO-PILOT gets a brief glimpse of headlights through t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock!  He was right there. The headlights are gone.  Nothing but darkness below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He musta turned his lights of if.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't drive down there without lights.  We just can't see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not driving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weather forecast BLARES from the radio of the steaming crumpled into a tree, the driver's door open. A POLICE OFFICER, pistol drawn, approaches the car cautio OTHER OFFICERS and AGENTS stay behind trees, weapons read The POLICE OFFICER lunges forward, pointing his weapon in Jaguar.  He inspects the car, then turns and calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limping, bleeding from various cuts, COLE CRASHES through underbrush as he follows a stream through the woods. Suddenly, he sees what he's looking for. The FORD...barely visible in the moonlight, parked in the beside the stream.  The car looks empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total blackness!  The sound of keys in the lock. Then, the trunk swings open and COLE stands in the moonli looking down RAILLY is in the trunk, tears of rage and frustration in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard!  You total bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE backs away, as RAILLY scrambles out of the trunk, sw He slips, falls, and she starts kicking him as she rants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have died in there.  If something had happened to you I would have died. COLE is lying on the ground, looking up, his lip caked wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I...I'm really sorry. Noticing his cuts and torn clothes, she stops kicking him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done?  Did you...kill someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I...don't think so.  I stole a car and they chased me.  I hit a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See -- you can drive after all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sort of, I guess.  I...I'm sorry I locked you up.  I thought...I thought... I think maybe I am crazy! She looks at him.  Breakthrough?  Very calm now, the doct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey Mason said it was my idea about the virus.  And suddenly, I wasn't sure.  We talked when I was in the institution, and it was all...fuzzy. The drugs and stuff. (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think maybe I'm the one who wiped out the human race?  It was my idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is going to wipe out the human race.  Not you or Jeffrey or anybody else.  You've created something in your mind, James -- a substitute reality. In order to avoid something you don't want to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm..."mentally divergent".  I would love to believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be dealt with, but only if you want to.  I can help you. COLE reacts to the sound of VOICES in the woods, dogs BAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help all right.  They're coming after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, it's important that you surrender to them instead of them catching you running.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be great if I'm crazy.  If I'm wrong about everything...the world will be okay.  I'll never have to live underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun! ... I lost it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gun! (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stars!  Air!  I can live here.  Breathe! RAILLY starts around to the front of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to attract their attention, let them know where we are, okay? RAILLY gets in the driver's seat...and starts to HONK the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll tell you to put your hands on top of your head.  Do what they tell you.  You're going to get better, James -- I know it! ANGLE ON COLE, spotting something on the ground.  An inse reaches down to grab it, but, instead, grins, grabs some stands, and starts rubbing it happily all over his face. HORN BLARES as COLE looks up at the sky. ANGLE ON THE NIGHT SKY, the moon full, the sky rich with ANGLE ON COLE, tears of joy running down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this world! ANGLE ON RAILLY, in the driver's seat, hearing near-by SH from the woods.  The police are almost here.  She gets ou car, starts around toward COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, I'm going to help you.  I'll stay with you.  I won't let them... She breaks off mid-sentence...stares, stunned! COLE is gone.  Disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY is being "debriefed" by POLICE OFFICERS and FBI AG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I said something to him about cooperating and he said he would do that, so I got in the car and started honking the horn.  When I got out, he was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lucked out.  For a while we thought you were a body they found down state... mutilated. A COP enters, hands a photo to LIEUTENANT HALPERIN who st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't do something like that -- he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts, hands her the photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the man he attacked? RAILLY looks at the photo, an 8 x 10 of the FIRST THUG, s against the alley wall, obviously dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to be clear about this.  That man and the other one were..."severely" beating us.  James Cole didn't start it.  In fact -- he saved me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny thing, Doctor, maybe you can explain it to me, you being a psychiatrist -- why do kidnap victims almost always try to tell us about the guys who grabbed 'em and try to make us understand how kind these bastards really were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if reciting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a normal reaction to a life- threatening situation. (suddenly animated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick.  He thinks he comes from the future.  He's been living in a carefully constructed fantasy world and that world is starting to disintegrate.  He needs help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG COLE stares, eyes wide. He sees the BRUNETTE, cradling the head of the BLONDE MAN sprawls on the concourse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we gave him too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE blinks awake. All he can see are blurry faces hoveri him, hammering him with questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cole, cooperate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out... you went to the home of a famous virologist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...don't...exist!  You're in my mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What's that?  What did he say?  His brain's fried.  Give him another shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows film of RAILLY leaving the police station. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kidnap victim seemed exhausted but apparently unharmed by her 30 hour ordeal as she left the police station in Philadelphia this morning.  So far she has refused to make a public statement. RAILLY'S friends, MARILOU and WAYNE, are watching the TV. A door opens and KATHRYN RAILLY, wearing a robe, comes ou bedroom.  She still looks exhausted   Followed by her cat enters the kitchen area and turns on the kettle as WAYNE turns down the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'm in a state of hyper- alertness.  I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you take the sedative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate those things.  They mess my head up. The old mug shot of COLE appears on the screen and RAILLY the volume up. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with the kidnapping of the Baltimore woman, James Cole is now also wanted in connection with the brutal slaying of Rodney Wiggins, an ex-convict from... RAILLY goes to the window, pushes aside the drape, and se HER POV:  ACROSS THE STREET...A COP keeps watch. RAILLY (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they really expect him to come here? RAILLY returns to the kitchen area where MARILOU is getti tea things out. TV REPORTER on air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in Fresno, California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances sadly toward the TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead, isn't he -- that little boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.  It was just a "prank" he and his friends pulled. CLOSE ON RAILLY'S FACE... SHOCKED. ANGLE ON THE TV SCREEN, showing footage of a sheepish nin old boy being led out of a barn by the police.  The cops TV REPORTER (v.o.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorities have so far been noncommittal about whether they will try to file charges against the families of the children involved in the hoax. RAILLY stares at the TV, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICES!  SINGING!  COLE blinks awake, looks around, confu stares in disbelief.... Crowded around COLE'S bed, the SCIENTISTS are concluding ragged, out of tune, rendition of "BLUEBERRY HILL."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---found my thrills on Blueberry Hill... Seeing he's awake, SCIENTISTS break off the song and appl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, James!  Well done!  Nice going!  Congratulations!  Good for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During your "interview," while you were..."under the influence," you told us you liked music! COLE, confused, looks around, sees he's in a one-bed wind room adorned with cheap reproductions of 19th and 20th ce landscapes. The BOTANIST responds to COLE'S obvious disbelief with a friendly smile and the others join in rapid fire, overlap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the prison, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But just until you recover your, uh,... equilibrium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still a little... disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stress!  Time travel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stood up very well, considering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superior work!  Superior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You connected the Army of the 12 Monkeys to a world famous virologist and his son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others will take over now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back on the surface in a matter of months....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll retake the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very close!  Because of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unrolling a document)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, James...what you've been working for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full pardon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be out of here in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women will want to get to know you...

dialogues.speaker: BRAINLESS TWIT
dialogues.text: Unseen until now, two guards, TINY and SCARFACE, suddenly through the ring of SCIENTISTS, push COLE down, and tight loose restraints, already in place, but unnoticed before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you want to be well, James. And you will be...soon. COLE bursts into hysterical laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON KATHRYN RAILLY, insisting fiercely to someone,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He not only used the word "prank" -- he said the boy was hiding in a barn. RAILLY's talking to her former boss, DR. OWEN FLETCHER, p sitting across from her in his office, tapping his pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kidnapped you, Kathryn.  You saw him murder someone.  You knew there was a real possibility he would kill you, too.  You were under tremendous emotional stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God sakes, Owen, listen to me -- he knew about the boy in Fresno and he says three billion people are going to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn, you know he can't possibly know that.  You're a rational person. You're a trained psychiatrist.  You know the difference between what's real and what's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what we believe is what's accepted as "truth" now, isn't it, Owen?  Psychiatry -- it's the latest religion.  And we're the priests -- we decide what's right and what's wrong --we decide who's crazy and who isn't. ... I'm in trouble, Owen.  I'm losing my faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in his "hospital" room, COLE struggles without succ free himself from his restraints. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure fucked up, Bob! Startled, COLE freezes, then ignores the RASPY VOICE and continues his feverish struggle. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can understand you don't want your mistakes pointed out to you. I can relate to that, old Bob. COLE looks around in spite of himself.  Nothing to see bu walls and the landscape paintings. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know what you're thinking.  You're thinking I don't exist except in your head.  I can see that point of view.  But you could still talk to me, couldn't you? Carry on a decent conversation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you! In 1995!  In the real world! You were a bum!  You pulled out your teeth. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I pull out my teeth, Bob? They don't like that.  That's a no-no. And when did you say you saw me? In...1872?

dialogues.speaker: FUCK YOU
dialogues.text: RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yelling won't get you what you want.  You have to be smart to get what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?  What do I want? RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you want?  Sure you do, Bob.  You know what you want. COLE, agitated, rocks back and forth.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.  Tell me what I want. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see the sky -- and the ocean -- to be topside -- breathe the air -- to be with her. ... Isn't that right?  Isn't that what you want? Completely shaken, COLE hesitates for a long moment.  Whe speaks, it comes out of him like air...a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More...than...anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY'S in bed, asleep, having a very bad dream.  Sudden bedside phone RINGS.  Her eyes snap open.  A beat to orie herself.  RING.  She reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT HALPERIN'S OFFICE/RAILLY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HALPERIN, at his desk, talking into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Railly?  Jim Halperin, Philly P.D.. Sorry to call so early but... CLOSE ON RAILLY, eager, concerned. into the phone,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found him?  Is he all right? CLOSE ON HALPEPIN, noting her reaction with raised eyebro giving an "I told you so" look to the BLACK PLAINCLOTHES across his desk, then continuing into the phone,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au contraire, Doctor.  No sign of your good friend, the kidnapper.  However, the plot thickens.  I have a ballistic report on my desk that says the bullet you claim you removed from Mr. Cole's thigh is an antique...and all indications are it was fired...sometime prior to 1920. ANGLE ON RAILLY, reacting, stunned. ANGLE ON HALPERIN, continuing soberly now,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what I was thinking was, maybe if I sent a detective down there to talk with you, you could maybe revise or amplify on the circumstances.... Hello?  Hello?  Dr. Railly? HALPERIN considers the dead phone, glances at the COP aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand still on the receiver, RAILLY looks shocked.  Th hurries into her study and starts frantically pulling nea arranged piles of papers and books from a bookcase until finds a copy of her book.  She leafs through it hurriedly locates the picture of the Puerto Rican KID (JOSE) in WWI Peering closely, she tries to see everything in the pictu Then, she turns and reaches for a research folder of old photographs and rummages through it until she finds...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's an uncropped shot of JOSE being carried on the stret the trenches.  And there in the corner with no helmet, no mask, and just a bit of bare shoulder showing...it's COLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean shaven, clear eyed, COLE sits before the frowning S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food, the sky, the certain, uh, sexual temptations -- you haven't become "addicted" have you, Cole?  To that "dying" world'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!  I just want to do my part. To get us back on top...in charge of the planet.  And I have the experience, I know who the people are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really is the most qualified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all that..."behavior"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cole, a little hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we weren't "real," Cole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I don't think the human mind was built to exist in two different... whatever you call it..."dimensions." It's stressful, you said it yourselves, it gets you confused.  You don't know what's real and what's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what's real now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The SCIENTISTS start to confer openly among themselves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd have to bone up, catch up to our research, the latest clues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's proved to be a quick study... The ASTROPHYSICIST fixes COLE with a sharp, penetrating l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't trick us, you know.  It wouldn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why would you want to?  It'll be dangerously close to the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  There'd be no point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to think about it, Cole. Among ourselves.  We'll get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in front of a wall of glass in his office, overl hi-tech lab below where WORKERS in white "space suits" wo methodically, DR. MASON speaks angrily into a phone.  His ASSISTANT, whose features we don't see, stops writing a f on a blackboard and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reason to believe that my son may be planning to do what?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY, trying to stay calm, is talking to Dr. Mason on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I know it sounds insane but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Mason on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this doesn't seem very professional to me, in fact it's distressingly unprofessional for some- one who treated my son briefly (if indeed you actually are who you say you are) to take a sudden unsolicited interest in his mental health six years later, and to telephone a parent to express opinions that would be inappropriate... (breaks off, listens, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about "Monkey armies", Doctor.  Nothing whatsoever. If my son ever was involved in... (listens, then,)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be doubly inappropriate to discuss matters of security with you, Dr. Railly, but if it will put you at ease, neither my son nor any other unauthorized person has access to any potentially dangerous organisms in this laboratory.  Thank you for your concern. DR. MASON hangs up angrily and glares. DR. MASON'S ASSISTANT (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. "Kathryn" Railly????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The psychiatrist who was kidnapped by that man who broke into my house.  She seems to have been suddenly struck by the most preposterous notion about Jeffrey. DR. MASON'S ASSISTANT (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I attended a lecture once...Apocalyptic visions. We see Dr. Mason's ASSISTANT now.  It's DR. PETERS, the r haired man who insisted to Dr. Railly you didn't have to insane to think the world was coming to an end. DR. PETERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she succumbed to her own theoretical..."disease"? But DR. MASON is lost in thought, not listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given the nature of our work, we can't ever be careful enough.  I think we should review our security procedures, perhaps upgrade them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE is facing the BOTANIST who's using a pointer to indi various fading photos and newspaper clippings tacked on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's consider again our current information -- if the symptoms were first detected in Philadelphia on June 28, 1995, that makes us know that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was released in Philadelphia, probably on June 14, 1995.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it appeared sequentially after that in...? With a quick glance at the panel of SCIENTISTS staring at from behind the long table, COLE replies like a good pupi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Francisco, New Orleans, Rio de Janeiro, Rome, Kinshasa, Karachi, Bangkok, then Peking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning...???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the virus was taken from Philadelphia to San Francisco, then to New Orleans, Rio de Janeiro, Rome, Kinshasa, Karachi, Bangkok, then Peking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your only goal is...???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find out where the virus is so a qualified scientist can travel back into the past and study the original virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that...???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, so that a vaccine can be developed that will, uh, allow mankind to reclaim the surface of the earth. COLE glances nervously at the suspicious SCIENTISTS as th BOTANIST switches on a slide projector and projects... a magazine photo of wall graffiti:  "ATTENTION!!!  POLICE

dialogues.speaker: WATCHING
dialogues.text: BOTANIST (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from a magazine printed in late September, 1995.  The writer speculated that this graffiti might be related to the epidemic that by that time had already killed thirty million people world-wide and was getting worse.  He says, certain people, unnamed, were questioned, but what came of that is not known.  But it is a clue you should pursue. COLE stares at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD BANGING!  The storefront window, completely covered posters, quivers violently.  Images of MONKEYS covered wi electrodes, BABY SEALS being viciously clubbed, DOGS jamm tiny cages quiver as somebody beats on the window.  It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFFREY, BEN, TEDDY, and two of JEFFREY'S youthful cohort and KWESKIN, wait motionless beside a heap of cardboard c as FALE peeks out the front window through a slit between

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the kidnap woman -- the one who was with the guy who tied us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's drawing attention to us, that's what she's doing. ... I don't know what you're up to this time, Mason, but you're gonna get us in deep shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whine, whine, whine.  What about walkie talkies?  We used to have walkie talkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From littered doorways, DERELICTS sneak peeks at RAILLY a seemingly mad, shakes the doorknob, then hammers on the d

dialogues.speaker: KNOW YOU'RE IN THERE
dialogues.text: RASPY VOICE (o.s)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret experiments! RAILLY whirls, sees LOUIE, the raspy-voiced toothless der

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they do -- secret weird stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  I know you! But LOUIE is studying the pictures of the tortured animal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just on them.  Do 'em on people, too -- down at the shelters.  Feed 'em chemicals 'n take pictures of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen James Cole?  The man...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watchin' you.  Takin' pictures. RAILLY follows his look. ANGLE ON AN OLD CHEVY, parked across the street, the PLAI COP slouched at the wheel, pretending to read a newspaper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police.  I know.  Listen, I need to talk to James, but he has to be careful how he contacts me.  He mustn't get caught.  Do you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, sure.  Uh...who's James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was with me, he spoke to you. Several weeks ago.  He said you were from the future...watching him. LOUIS gives her a look that says, "I'm outta here!" But just then, RAILLY spots two TEZNAGE PUNKS surreptitio "tagging" their way along the street with cans of spray p RAILLY stares at the PUNKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FALE watches JEFFREY go over a check list while KWESKIN, and TEDDY organize materials, and BEN peeks out the small between posters at the front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the bolt cutters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dozen.  They're in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dozen bolt cutters!  Whadda you gonna do with one dozen bolt cutters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Absolutely not. Don't tell me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Do you know what she's doing? Everybody freezes, looking toward 3EN, who's peeking outs Then, except for JEFFREY, they all crowd around BEN to ge POV THROUGH SLIT:  a glimpse of RAILLY, spray painting th of the store!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (erupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spinning around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your psychiatrist?  Did you just say, "your psychiatrist"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-psychiatrist!  Now, what about flashlights?  How many flashlights...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman is...was...your... psychiatrist?  And now she's spray- painting our building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SLACK PLAINCLOTHES COP, across the street in the amazed, watching RAILLY spray painting.  He shakes his he ANGLZ ON STREET TYPES, inching closer, watching RAILLY wi amazement, too.  They include... an IRISH DRUNK, white haired, red-faced, bloated... a NATIVE AMERICAN with tormented eyes and a mangled ear.. an AFRICAN AMERICAN with one eye... the TEENAGED PUNKS... a WHITE MAN, shabbily dressed, joining the knot of ONLOOK reacting at the sight of RAILLY.  It's COLE!  He pushes t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn! RAILLY stops spraying, whips around at the sound of his V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James! With a quick glance toward the PLAINCLOTHES COP, RAILLY t urgent charge of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!  That's a policeman.  Pretend you don't know me.  If he sees you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning, looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to turn myself in.  Where is he? (placing his hands on his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry -- it's all okay now.  I'm not crazy any more!  I mean, I am crazy, mentally divergent, actually, but I know it now and I want you to help me.  I want to get well... ANGLE on RAILLY, desperately pulling COLE'S hands off his she tries to block the COP'S view of COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James -- put your hands down and listen to me.  Things have changed! ANGLE ON THE PLAINCLOTHES COP, checking the mug shot of C his clipboard, then reaching for his radio mike. ANGLE ON RAILLY, reacting to the COP speaking into his mi tosses the spray paint can aside, grabs COLE and tries to him along...but COLE isn't moving.  He's staring at the f the FAA Store with disbelief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, come on!  We have to get out of here! COLE looks from the wall to the can rolling on the sidewa then back to the wall where RAILLY has sprayed the huge w ATTENTION!!!  POLICE ARE WATCHING! IS THERE A VIRUS?  IS THIS THE SOURCE?  THREE BILLION DIE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the graffiti COLE saw in the future, in the picture!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen that...before. But RAILLY'S total attention is on their dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, trust me.  We're in terrible trouble.  We have to run. Very confused, COLE lets her drag him along the sidewalk, ONLOOKERS.  She looks crazier than he does. ANGLE ON THE CHEVY, making a sudden, urgent u-turn, almos colliding with a passing car.  BRAKES SQUEAL and a HORN B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BEN, peeking out, reacting to the drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, a guy in a Chevy is chasing her and some other guy I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem, it's probably just another kidnapping featuring Jeffrey's shrink, pardon me, make that ex-shrink. (indicating Jeffrey to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your leader, a certifiable lunatic who told his former psychiatrist all his plans for God knows what whacko irresponsible schemes, and now who knows what she's painted out there on our wall?

dialogues.speaker: WALLS
dialogues.text: (moves to Fale, jabs him with a finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I told her about the Army of the 12 Monkeys?  Impossible!  Know why, you pathetically ineffectual and pusillanimous "pretend-friend-to- animals"?!  I'll tell you why:  because when I had anything to do with her six years ago, there was no such thing -- I hadn't even thought of it yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come she knows what's going on? JEFFREY abruptly switches from rage to good humor, adopti supercilious smile and a patronizing tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my theory on that.  While I was institutionalized, my brain was studied exhaustively in the guise of mental health. I was interrogated, x-rayed, studied thoroughly.  Then, everything about me was entered into a computer where they created a model of my mind. They all stare, mesmerized, at the strutting JEFFREY.  Is serious?  Is he crazy?  Doesn't matter -- he's charismati JEFFREY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, using the computer model, they generated every thought I could possibly have in the next, say ten years, which they then filtered through a probability matrix to determine everything I was going to do in that period.  So you see, she knew I was going to lead the Army of the Twelve Monkeys into the pages of history before it ever even occurred to me.  She knows everything I'm ever going to do before I know it myself.  How about that? JEFFREY smiles smugly into FALE'S flabbergasted face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I have to get going -- do my part. You guys check all this stuff out and load up the van.  Make sure you have everything.  I'm outta here. JEFFREY exits.  The others stare at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's seriously crazy -- you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overflowing dumpster squats near the mouth of an alley The unmarked CHEVY crawls slowly past the alley, the PLAI COP'S eyes searching everywhere. Trash stirs in the dumpster and RAILLY'S eyes peer up out torn cardboard boxes, rotting food, and styrofoam litter. HER POV:  the POLICE CAR passes from view. ANGLE ON RAILLY, emerging from the refuse, hissing,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!  Come on. A confused COLE emerges from the opposite end of the dump bits of lettuce in his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing out of the dumpster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're avoiding the police until I can....talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing out after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, treat me?  Cure me?  Kathryn, those words on the wall -- I've seen them before...  I...I...dreamed them. But she's not listening.  She's peeking out the alley ent RAILLY'S POV:  across the street is a run-down skid row h THE GLOBE, ROOMS WEEKLY, DAILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DESK CLERK, an old alkie who hates trouble but finds stares across the counter suspiciously at RAILLY and COLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five bucks an hour.
