dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want quarter hours, go someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catches on, pulls out her last bills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's ninety eight.  For the night.  Deal? The DESK CLERK squints warily at this turn of events.  Th turns, gets a key, turns back and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty four.  Fourth floor, turn right. Elevator's busted. RAILLY turns, COLE follows, and they walk quickly to the passing the stares of gloomy RESIDENTS sitting on torn so chairs in front of an old TV with hideous color. ANGLE ON THE DESK CLERK, watching RAILLY and COLE climb stairs.  As they disappear from view, he picks up the pho punches a number, speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy?  This is Charlie at the Globe. You know if Wallace has a new girl? Sort of a rookie type?  Blonde?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE sits on the lumpy bed in the dingy room, watching RA pace back and forth like a mad woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...you were standing there looking at the moon...you were eating grass... then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was in...prison again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?  You were in prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really.  It's...it's in my mind.  Like you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappeared!  One minute you were there, the next minute you were gone. Did you run through the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy in the well.  How did you know that was just a hoax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was?  I didn't...know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, you said he was hiding in the barn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I saw a TV show like that when I was a kid.  Where a boy...

dialogues.speaker: IT WASN'T A TV SHOW
dialogues.text: COLE looks at her.  She's really upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that kid saw the same TV show and copied it.  Listen, you were right, it's all in my head.  I'm mentally ill, I imagine all that stuff.  I know they're not real, I can trick them, make them do what I want.  I just worked on them in my head and I got back here.  I can get better.  I can stay here. RAILLY pulls a photo from her purse, shows it to COLE. It's the uncropped picture from her book, the photo of JO WWI with a fuzzy image of COLE on the edge of the frame,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this mean to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I had a dream about...something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a bullet from World War One in your leg, James!  How did it get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said I had delusions -- that I created a world -- you said you could explain everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't. ... I mean...I'm trying to.  I can't believe that everything we do or say has already happened, that we can't change what's going to happen, that I'm one of the three billion people who are going to die...soon. COLE stands, moves close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be here.  In this time.  With you.  I want to become...become a whole person.  I want this to be the present. I want the future to be unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden hopeful idea!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James...do you remember...six years ago...you had a phone number!  You tried to call and... WHAM!  The door flies open, kicked violently, the flimsy holding.  A menacing figure stands in the doorway.  WALLA wiry biker-type with jail house tattoos and mean eyes. COLE and RAILLY are too stunned to say anything as WALLAC them over coldly, insolently, then advances on RAILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my territory, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused, turns to Railly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this real -- or is this one of my delusions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is definitely real: (to Wallace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I think we have a little misunderstanding here... WALLACE smashes RAILLY in the face.  She flies back again wall and onto the floor as WALLACE spins around to COLE w stepping toward him, but WALLACE is now holding a knife

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you -- some kind of tough guy? You wanna be a hero?  You gonna try and mess with me?  Come on... A beat.  COLE puts his hands up placatingly as he backs a WALLACE and moves to RAILLY, whose eye is already swellin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a smart boy.  But you, honey, you think you can go 'round me and peddle your fancy ass in this part of town, you bet your life we got what I would call a major goddamn misunderstandin'. RAILLY reaches a hand up to COLE for assistance, but, he her purse instead, swings it around, SMASHES WALLACE in t with it, then grabs the pimp's arm and SNAPS it like it w twig!  The knife clatters to the floor as WALLACE yelps i and COLE slams him to the floor, straddles his chest, ret the near-by knife, and presses it sharply against WALLACE

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: COLE hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes bulging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...heard...her.  Don't do it, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up, looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in the closet, ... But get his money first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to rob him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I...We need cash, James. A shadow.  RAILLY turns toward the door and glimpses a FA disappearing, then hears SHOUTS from the hallway... SHOUTS (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're killing him!  Call the cops. Being very careful not to move his neck, WALLACE reaches pocket and produces a thick roll of bills, which RAILLY g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two are crazy.  I got friends.  You put me in a closet, they're gonna be really pissed. COLE moves off Wallace and, keeping the knife close, yank his teeth while RAILLY hurries to the window and looks ou HER POV:  A fire escape leads down into an alley. RAILLY turns just in time to see COLE shove WALLACE into bathroom, follow him in, slam the door behind them, and L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY'S VOICE (from the other room) (rattling the door knob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, what are you doing? WALLACE cowers back against the shower stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have friends, man -- if you cut me... WALLACE breaks off, bug-eyed, reacting to something we do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...the...fuck..are you doing???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY is pounding on the bathroom door now as, suddenly, opens and COLE steps out, the knife in his right hand, dr with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, James.  Did you kill him? COLE shakes his head "no" as blood oozes from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...just in case.  In case I'm not crazy... (holds up two bloody molars)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how they find us.  By our teeth. (a beat, eye contact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want them to find me.  Ever.  I don't want to go back. RAILLY's astonishment turns to emotion as it dawns on her choice he's made.  Given up the future (if it exists, and looking like it does)!  Risking his life to be with her! this brief time!  She's overwhelmed, lips trembling, tear welling in her eyes.  But just then, the SOUNDS of SHOUTS feet THUNDERING up the stairs snap her back to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COPS' boots THUNDER up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between nervous glances toward the door, RAILLY superv COLE obediently blocks the bathroom door with the bureau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push it tight! WALLACE'S VOICE (from the bathroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE OFFICERS, led by the PLAINCLOTHES COP, make a caut entrance onto the 4th floor, guns drawn. Seedy HOTEL RESIDENTS point to Room 44, then cower back i their doorways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLE and RAILLY clatter down the fire-escape, COLE in the They come to the end of the metal stairway.  It's a long to the ground.  COLE jumps down, turns, reaches up to her She lets herself down to him.  Their eyes meet.  He holds his arms for a moment.  Then, reluctantly, he puts her do They start running down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLAINCLOTHES COP has his pistol out, his back to the alongside the open doorway to Room 44.  The UNIFORMED OFF are backing him up, weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: COME OUTTA THERE
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLAINCLOTHES COP charges into the room in a crouch, p extended in both hands.  He pans the gun around the empty HIS POV:  the open window...the blood on the floor. WALLACE'S VOICE (from the bathroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city bus disgorges a stream of PASSENGERS at a stop in toney downtown shopping district.  Among them, RAILLY loo furtively left and right, COLE on her heels.  She's hidde bruised eye behind sun glasses; he's holding a bloody handkerchief to his mouth. As he steps to the sidewalk, COLE is overwhelmed by the b city, the tall downtown buildings.  His eyes go up. COLE'S POV:  a building, towering toward the sky.  A buil with a ledge.  The same ledge the lion prowled in the fut ANGLE ON COLE, shaken, as RAILLY ushers him into the rece entrance to a store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.  I'm going to try that phone number.  Let's hope it's nothing! Dazed by his experience and the flow of SHOPPERS, COLE wa her hurry to a pay phone twenty yards away, his view of h intermittent by PEDESTRIANS streaming past him, their FAC looming frighteningly close. A BUSINESSMAN jostles COLE, forcing him back against the window.  Turning, he faces the angry jaws of a BEAR only Recovering from a jolt of terror, COLE realizes the BEAR toy in the display window.  Relieved, he looks back at RA COLE'S POV:  RAILLY, well out of earshot, speaking earnes the phone. ANGLE ON COLE, startled, as a BUSINESSMAN, mistaking him panhandler, shoves a dollar into his hand.  Confused, COL at the dollar, then turns to say something to the retreat BUSINESSMAN, but just then he sees RAILLY rushing toward eyes sparkling with happiness, LAUGHING, ebullient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James!  James!  It's okay.  We're insane!  We're crazy! COLE doesn't know how to respond, but a PASSERBY gives th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Carpet Cleaning Company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Carpet Cleaning Company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No superiors!  No scientists.  No people from the future.  It's just a Carpet Cleaning Company.  They have voice mail -- you leave a message telling them when you want your carpet cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you left them a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't resist.  I was so relieved. Wait'll they hear this nutty woman telling them...they better watch out for the Army of the Twelve Monkeys... Looking at her laughing face, COLE is struck with horror realizes the truth!  He starts to recite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Army of the Twelve Monkeys -- they're the ones who are going to do it.  I can't do anything more.  The police are watching me." Now she's stunned.  She glances back and sees the phone b twenty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you couldn't have heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got your message, Kathryn.  They played it for me.  It was a bad recording...distorted.  I didn't recognize your voice. RAILLY'S eyes fill with horror as she grasps the meaning. ANGLE ON A UNIFORMED COP, staring out the window of a POL CRUISER as it inches along in the bumper to bumper traffi Noticing something, he reaches for his radio. ANGLE ON RAILLY, spotting the CRUISER, grabbing COLE, pul into the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY, whose sun glasses don't really hide her bruised e a man's Hawaiian shirt to the pile of other men's things on a counter in front of a very suspicious CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this. (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else? But COLE'S not here.  He's a short distance away...starin COLE'S POV:  aisle after aisle of eager shoppers and a bo brand new consumer goods. ANGLE ON COLE, remembering another department store, dark full of moldering merchandise. ANGLE ON RAILLY, turning again to the CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I put this on your account, Ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (producing Wallace's roll of bills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I'll pay cash. The CLERK stares at the huge roll of bills!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What floor are the wigs on, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by stripped and abandoned vehicles, the VAN, w PEST CONTROL logo on its side, is parked on a trash-litte street beside the massive pillars of a towering freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VAN is packed with SIX ACTIVISTS, SANDY and KWESKIN a them, all wearing black.  Some of them have climbing gear belts, all sorts of paraphernalia.  KWESKIN is telling hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then he goes into this incredible riff about how his shrink, like, replicated his brain while he was in the nut house. Turned it into a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Fale believed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know Fale!  He's like, "If you guys get nailed -- and I'm sure you will -- I never saw you before in nay life!" LAUGHTER from all of them.  Then, there's a sharp, rhythm series of RAPS on the side door, a signal. POPE quickly slides the door open.  It's JEFFREY...grinni Three other activists, GOINES, ICHIOKA, and BRUHNS, stagg the darkness behind JEFFREY, lugging a huge, squirming GA The van occupants react with murmurs of "Awwwwwright" and out", then they help maneuver the writhing bag into the v Then, JEFFREY and the other three scramble in, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PEST CONTROL VAN lumbers up a ramp and onto the freew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GARBAGE BAG squirms and grunts as JEFFREY holds a map flashlight and goes over "the plan" with the other ACTIVI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's Stage One.  In Stage Two, Monkey Four is over here... A loud GROAN from the bag distracts the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the harm in opening the bag? His eyes are taped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's cruel leaving him like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but cruelty is his specialty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why should we be like him? Shrugging cheerfully, JEFFREY tears open the garbage bag DR. MASON, trussed up, duct tape covering his eyes and mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want the full effect? Grinning wickedly, JEFFREY rips the tape from his father'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey?  I know it's you, Jeffrey.  I recognize your voice. JEFFREY puts his finger to his lips, silencing everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFFREY???  ... Very well.  You're out of your mind, Jeffrey.  I know all about your insane plan.  That woman -- your psychiatrist -- she told me. JEFFREY raises his eyebrows.  This he hadn't expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't believe her -- it seemed too crazy even for you.  But, just in case, I took steps to make sure you couldn't do it.  I took myself out of the loop!  I don't have the code any more.  I don't have access to the virus.  So, go ahead -- torture me, but you can't extract anything of use to yourself. The ACTIVISTS are all exchanging puzzled looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...virus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spins his head toward Jeffrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew about it, Jeffrey.  She knew you were going to try this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What virus are we talking about, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane, Jeffrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You "develop" viruses and you're calling me insane?  Typical.  What does this virus attack?  Don't tell me, you sick fuck, it doesn't matter. (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I ever "developed" a virus?  Do I put helpless animals in cages and measure their reactions to electrical stimuli? Do I inject radioactive substances into living creatures and examine their bowel movements?  Wow!  And I'm crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me, Jeffrey, what exactly are you going to do?  I don't have to tell you I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooky BERNARD HERRMAN MUSIC, giant redwoods looming skyw It's DAYTIME in Muir Woods.  SCOTTY (JAMES STEWART) AND M (KIM NOVAK) walk toward a display of a cross cut section redwood tree.  We're watching Hitchcock's VERTIGO. SCOTTY (up on the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a cross section of one of the old trees that's been cut down. They look at the lines of the tree marked with cards that

dialogues.speaker: "BIRTH OF CHRIST", "DISCOVERY OF AMERICA", "MAGNA CARTA S
dialogues.text: "1066 - BATTLE OF HASTINGS", and "1930 TREE CUT DOWN". ANGLE ON THE THEATER AUDIENCE, empty seats dimly visible flickering light, a few shadowy MOVIEGOERS scattered here ANGLE ON THE SCREEN, MADELINE pointing, saying with profo MADELINE (up on the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in here I was born.  And here -- I die.  There's only a moment for you.  You don't notice. ANGLE ON THE AUDIENCE, a shadowy COUPLE near the back of theater.  WE CAN'T REALLY SEE THEM, but we recognize thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me help you. The theater is briefly illuminated by a very bright scene screen, revealing enough of COLE and RAILLY for us to see doing something to his upper lip while he tries to watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've seen this movie before. When I was a kid.  It was on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fussing with his upper lip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh -- don't talk.  Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving his head to see the film)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have seen it, but I don't remember this part.  Funny, it's like what's happening to us, like the past.  The movie never changes -- it can't change -- but everytime you see it, it seems to be different because you're different -- you notice different things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can't change anything...because it's already happened, then we ought to at least smell the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowers!  What flowers? From the darkness, a MOVIE PATRON makes a SSSSHHHHH shoun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an expression.  Here... She's pulling something from a shopping bag at her feet, it on COLE'S head, adjusting it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can stick our heads out the window and feel the wind and listen to the music.  So we can appreciate what we have while we have it.  Forgive me, psychiatrists don't cry. There are tears in her eyes.  They discomfit COLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But maybe I'm wrong.  Maybe you're wrong.  Maybe we're both crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a few weeks, it will have started or it won't.  If there are still baseball games and traffic jams, armed robberies and boring TV shows -- we'll be so happy, we'll be glad to turn ourselves in to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can we hide for a few weeks? ANGLE ON THE SCREEN, where SCOTTY and MADELINE are in the the OCEAN behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd never seen the ocean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A GORILLA, by moonlight, angry, a true nightmare URGENT WHISPERS off screen, RUSTLING SOUNDS.  Then, METAL Only now are we aware that the GORILLA is in an outdoor z with phony rocks.  Stalking back and forth.  Huge.  Upset CLANK.  CLANK.  METAL ON METAL.  GRUNTS of effort, then, MASON'S VOICE, plaintive, frightened. DR. MASON'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to me?  Where are we?  Jeffrey, please... SANDY'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, put the tape back on his mouth! The GORILLA bellows angrily, beating his chest. JEFFREY'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the tape.  The monkey's louder than he is.  You gonna tape the monkey's mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the full moon, PANTHERS pace back and forth, back a forth, uttering ominous guttural SNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KING OF BEASTS gives a deep, fierce ROAR.  From the d unseen ELEPHANTS TRUMPET their response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PANDEMONIUM of WINGS RUSTLING, the sharp metallic CLINK metal on metal, the MUTTER of HUMAN VOICES, then a cacoph CRESCENDO of frenzied SCREECHING as PARROTS, COCKATOOS an EXOTIC BIRDS careen madly in their cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON COLE, dozing fitfully, as the SOUNDS of SCREAMIN continue.  Suddenly, he comes awake with a start...sees t filling his field of vision. HIS POV:  the MOVIE SCREEN.  TIPPI HEDRIN, overwhelmed by screeching BIRDS in an attic in Hitchcock's THE BIRDS. ANGLE ON COLE, orienting himself, looking around.  Empty both sides of him.  He's alone.  He panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lobby poster boasts "Classics 24 Hours A Day" and "Hitc Festival".  PANNING OFF the poster, passing a SNORING USH to the world in an old velvet chair, WE DISCOVER a BRUNET tight dress, just hanging up the lobby pay phone.  Turnin reveals heavy make-up, gaudy costume jewelry, and sun gla She's the BRUNETTE in COLE'S DREAM!  Crossing the lobby t the auditorium, it's a pleasure to watch her nice body un in the tight dress. Just then, the auditorium doors burst open and a BLONDE M Hawaiian shirt appears, the man from COLE'S DREAM, except man's moustache is fixed firmly on his upper lip.  The BL stops, stunned at the sight of the BRUNETTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're booked on a 9:30 flight to Key West. The Brunette is RAILLY, no longer the frazzled profession revealed now by her disguise as a sexy babe.  The Blonde COLE!  He's confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in my dream just now.  I didn't recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you look pretty different, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean in my dream -- I didn't realize it was you.  Then...I woke up and I...I thought you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studies him seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you...like this.  I feel I've known you before.  I feel I've always known you. Their eyes lock.  Suddenly, she backs up, gently maneuver with her, past the sleeping USHER, to and through an unlo unmarked door, then closing it behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAILLY and COLE are in a dimly lit cluttered storage room kisses him hungrily amid the brooms, plastic trash barrel janitorial items.  COLE responds to her passion as they m deeper into the room, its walls covered with old movie po Tearing at each other's clothes, they collapse on a rolle theater curtain among stacks of ancient theater seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red rim of the rising sun is just becoming visible be silhouetted roofs of an upper middle-class suburban neigh The early light is so vague that when a huge SIBERIAN TIG across a neatly-trimmed lawn, he's more a shadowy vision reality.  Did we really see him at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rising sun flares behind the towering silhouette of a building, deserted in the early morning light.  High up, his head around a girder. Four stories below, other MONKEYS are climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted in the first light of dawn, the stores face each across a broad promenade with blank staring windows. Nothing happens.  For a long moment.  Then, an AFRICAN BU ELEPHANT appears, turning the corner, lumbering toward us the promenade, raising his trunk to TRUMPET triumphantly other ELEPHANTS trotting into view behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fiftyish WOMAN CABBIE with white hair and a Southern tw at the wheel of the cab. WOMAN CABBlE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time's your flight, friends? In the back seat, COLE, in the blonde wig and moustache, his companion, the sexy babe in sun glasses and heavy mak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine thirty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled, checks her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight?  My watch says 7:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your normal mornin', okay, plenty a time, but today, gotta take inta account your Army-of-the-Twelve-Monkeys factor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve Monkeys, honey.  Guess you folks didn't turn on your radio this morning. COLE and RAILLY exchange a quick look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch a weirdoes let all the animals outta the zoo last night.  Then they locked up this big shot scientist in one of the cages. Scientist's own kid was one a the ones did it! RAILLY and COLE stare at the cabbie, stunned. WOMAN CABBlE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they got animals all over the place.  Buncha zebras shut down the thruway 'bout an hour ago and some kinda thing called an "e-mu" it's got traffic blocked for miles over on 22. Flabbergasted, RAILLY'S eyes suddenly fill with hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they were up to!  Freeing animals!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the walls -- they meant the animals when they said, "We did it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hear it on the radio all the stations... As the WOMAN CAEBIE switches on the RADIO, RA:LLY points follows her look. COLE'S POV:  two CHEETAHS, sleek and magnificent against cityscape, streaking past the cab at ninety mph! ANNOUNCER/RADIO (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, numerous animal rights activists have joined the chorus condemning what they're calling the "loose canon" activities of Jeffrey Mason and his Army of the Twelve Monkeys. RIGHTS ACTIVIST/RADIO (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can these fools seriously believe that releasing a captive animal into an urban environment is being compassionate to the animal?  It's mindlessly cruel, almost as indefensible as holding the animal in captivity in the first place. RAILLY and COLE are watching FLAMINGOS cross the sky agai backdrop of skyscrapers in silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSY ON copies of the mug shot of COLE and a photo of RA while the airport P.A. SYSTEM DRONES in the b.g.. REVEAL a DETECTIVE, giving the flyers to the uniformed SU at one end of the ticket counter.

The Army of The Twelve Monkeys are just dumb kids playing revolutionaries.  It was someone else! COLE looks around nervously, catches a BUSINESSMAN at the phone looking away quickly.  COLE touches his loose moust he averts his face and speaks into the phone in an urgent

dialogues.text: I've done my job.  I did what you wanted. Good luck.  I'm not coming back! COLE hangs up the phone, looks around, catches a few star Averting his face, he heads for the Men's Room.
